question: The United Nations General Assembly declared 2011–20 as the United Nations Decade on _?
explanation: The United Nation General Assembly has declared 2011-20 as the decade on Biodiversity, which serves to support and promote the goal of significantly reducing the biodiversity loss. 70% of the world species is found in just 12 countries. According to the WWF Living Planet Report 2014, between 1970 and 2010, the planet has lost 52% of its biodiversity. Estimates of the number of species on Earth vary from 3 million to over 100 million.
